intro: Psychotria nudiceps, commonly known as the naked-headed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive shape. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Psychotria nudiceps is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
